title: The Breach at Merchant's Gate
subtitle: When trusted writs became weapons
blurb: Seven entities entered through trusted writs and moved like ink through commerce, records, keys, and vaults. The Kingdom survived, but only by invoking a dangerous Purge Script and accepting loss.

title: The Poisoned Protocol
subtitle: On the nature of threats too small to notice
blurb: A small logging library. Six months of silent corruption. Merchant-Lord Cassia faces an impossible choice: shut down half the Kingdom's commerce or watch the corruption spread. When you can't monitor everything, which risks do you accept?

title: The Wall That Held
subtitle: Commander Valdris and the Northern Gate siege
blurb: Before he was High Commander, Valdris Ironheart was a young officer at the Northern Gate when the largest coordinated assault in a generation struck the Borderlands. The wall held. Valdris earned his scar—and learned the cost of command.

title: The Choice Between Walls
subtitle: How Queen Lyra earned her crown
blurb: During the Great Corruption, a young princess faced an impossible choice: save the outer districts or protect the Crown City core. The decision she made—and the price she paid—defined both her reign and her relationship with the Dreaming Tower.

title: The Shadow's Price
subtitle: How Shade found Whisper—or Whisper found him
blurb: A former Ministry agent ventures into ARCHIVE-NULL seeking forbidden knowledge. What he finds instead is an ancient entity sealed away for reasons no one remembers—and a bond that will change them both forever.

title: The Harvest Festival Incident
subtitle: When Cassia learned to listen
blurb: Merchant-Lord Cassia dismissed the security warnings as overcautious—until the Festival Day attack proved the Lorekeeper right. A story about the cost of ignoring warnings and the humility that comes from being wrong.

title: The First Waking
subtitle: How the Tower learned to dream
blurb: A thousand years ago, the Dreaming Tower was just an observatory. This is the story of the first Lorekeeper, the crisis that nearly destroyed Cipheria, and the moment when cold stone began to dream.
